unbbayes.datamining.datamanipulation
Class Instance

java.lang.Object
  |
  +--unbbayes.datamining.datamanipulation.Instance
public class Instance
extends java.lang.Object

Class for handling an instance. All values (numeric or nominal) are internally stored as short numbers. The stored value is the index of the corresponding nominal value in the attribute's definition.

Version:
$1.0 $ (16/02/2002)
Author:
Mário Henrique Paes Vieira (mariohpv@bol.com.br)

Field Detail

MISSING_VALUE

public static final short MISSING_VALUE
Constant representing a missing value.

See Also:
Constant Field Values
Constructor Detail

Instance

public Instance(Instance instance)
Constructor that copies the attribute values from the given instance. Reference to the dataset is set to null. (ie. the instance doesn't have access to information about the attribute types).

Parameters:
instance - Instance from which the attribute values are to be copied

Instance

public Instance(short[] attValues)
Constructor that inititalizes instance variable with given values. Reference to the dataset is set to null. (ie. the instance doesn't have access to information about the attribute types). Weight is set to 1.

Parameters:
attValues - An array of attribute values

Instance

public Instance(int weight,
                short[] attValues)
Constructor that inititalizes instance variable with given values. Reference to the dataset is set to null. (ie. the instance doesn't have access to information about the attribute types)

Parameters:
weight - the instance's weight
attValues - a vector of attribute values

setWeight

public final void setWeight(int weight)
Sets the weight of an instance.

Parameters:
weight - the weight

getWeight

public final int getWeight()
Returns the instance's weight.

Returns:
the instance's weight as a double

getClassIndex

public final int getClassIndex()
Returns the class attribute's index.

Returns:
The class index as an integer
Throws:
UnassignedDatasetException - if instance doesn't have access to a dataset

classIsMissing

public final boolean classIsMissing()
Tests if an instance's class is missing.

Returns:
True if the instance's class is missing
Throws:
UnassignedClassException - if the class is not set or the instance doesn't have access to a dataset

classValue

public final short classValue()
Returns an instance's class value in internal format. (ie. as a short number)

Returns:
The corresponding value as a short (It returns the value's index as a short).
Throws:
UnassignedClassException - if the class is not set or the instance doesn't have access to a dataset

copy

public java.lang.Object copy()
Produces a shallow copy of this instance. The copy has access to the same dataset. (if you want to make a copy that doesn't have access to the dataset, use new Instance(instance)

Returns:
the shallow copy

public final boolean isMissing(int attIndex)
Tests if a specific value is "missing".

Parameters:
attIndex - Attribute's index

isMissing

public final boolean isMissing(Attribute att)
Tests if a specific value is "missing". The given attribute has to belong to a dataset.

Parameters:
att - Attribute

public static final boolean isMissingValue(short val)
Tests if the given value codes "missing".

Parameters:
val - Value to be tested
Returns:
true if val codes "missing"

public static final short missingValue()
Returns the short that codes "missing".

setClassMissing

public void setClassMissing()
Sets the class value of an instance to be "missing".

Throws:
UnassignedClassException - if the class is not set
UnassignedDatasetException - if the instance doesn't have access to a dataset

setMissing

public void setMissing(int attIndex)
Sets a specific value to be "missing".

Parameters:
attIndex - the attribute's index

setDataset

public final void setDataset(InstanceSet instances)
Sets the reference to the dataset. Does not check if the instance is compatible with the dataset. Note: the dataset does not know about this instance. If the structure of the dataset's header gets changed, this instance will not be adjusted automatically.

Parameters:
instances - Reference to the dataset

getDataset

public final InstanceSet getDataset()
Returns the reference to the dataset.

Returns:
instances Reference to the dataset

Throws:

toString

public java.lang.String toString()
Returns the description of one instance. If the instance doesn't have access to a dataset, it returns the internal short values.

Overrides:
toString in class java.lang.Object
Returns:
The instance's description as a string

toString

public java.lang.String toString(int attIndex)
Returns the description of one value of the instance as a string. If the instance doesn't have access to a dataset, it returns The internal short value.

Parameters:
attIndex - Attribute's index
Returns:
The value's description as a string

toString

public java.lang.String toString(Attribute att)
Returns the description of one value of the instance as a string. If the instance doesn't have access to a dataset it returns the internal short value. The given attribute has to belong to a dataset.

Parameters:
att - Attribute
Returns:
The value's description as a string
